caseTitle: MAG Entertainment (Pvt) Ltd. v. Independent Newspapers Corporation (Pvt) Ltd. and others
authorJudge: MR. JUSTICE MIAN SAQIB NISAR, HCJ
tagline: Section 23 of the PEMRA Ordinance confers upon PEMRA a duty to ensure that undue concentration of media ownership is not created and Section 39(e) of the Ordinance allows PEMRA to frame rules with respect to defining the circumstances constituting undue concentration of media ownership and abuse of powers and anti-competitive practices by media companies. As the regulator, PEMRA is best placed to assess ?media market?. Article 18 of the Constitution allows for the regulation of businesses which may be in the form of licenses carrying certain conditions to protect the public interest.
